tatami.simulation

Interface AgentLoader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeAgentLoader

    public interface AgentLoader
    The agent loader is the interface to an instance that uses existing scenario information to completely specify loading information for an agent.
    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  AgentLoader.StandardAgentLoaderType
      Standard types of loaders for agents.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CLASSPATH_ATTRIBUTE
      The name of the attribute containing the class path of the AgentLoader class, in the XML file.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_LOADER
      The default agent loader to use, if no other is specified.
      static java.lang.String NAME_ATTRIBUTE
      The name of the attribute containing the loader name in the XML file.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the the name of the agent loader, as used in the scenario file.

      • setConfig

        AgentLoader setConfig(net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode configuration)
        Configures the loader by passing the XML node in the scenario. The loader can extract the necessary settings.

        The method should not perform any initializations that can fail. These should be done in the load(AgentCreationData) method.

        Parameters:
        configuration - the XML node containing the configuration of the loader.
        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • preload

        boolean preload(AgentCreationData agentCreationData,
              PlatformLoader plaformLoader,
              net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log)
        The method checks potential problems that could appear in the creation of an agent, as specified by the information in the argument. Potential problems relate, for example, to inexistent classes.

        The method may also add information to the agent creation data, in order to speed up the loading process.

        WARNING: Calling this method before load(AgentCreationData) may not be optional. This method may affect the AgentCreationData instance.

        This method may contact the platform loader for details on the platform.

        If the agent will surely not be able to load, false will be returned. For any non-fatal issues, the method should return true and output warnings in the specified log.

        Parameters:
        agentCreationData - - the AgentCreationData, as loaded by Boot from the scenario file.
        plaformLoader - - the PlatformLoader that will be used to load the agent.
        log - - the Logger in which to output any potential problems (as warnings or errors).
        Returns:
        true if no fatal issues were found; false otherwise.

      • load

        AgentManager load(AgentCreationData agentCreationData)
        The method loads all the information necessary for the creation of an agent and returns an AgentManager instance used to manage the lifecycle of the loaded agent.

        WARNING: It is important to pre-load additional agent creation data using preload(AgentCreationData, PlatformLoader, Logger). Lacking this operation, the agent may not laod correctly.

        Parameters:
        agentCreationData - - the AgentCreationData, as loaded by Boot from the scenario file.
        Returns:
        an AgentManager for the loaded agent.
